name: Moldova
address: 1827 Coney Island Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11230, USA

reviews.text:
Everything needs to be excellent to have 5 stars. While the server and atmosphere were excellent, not all good was excellent. But, it was good. No complaints.
I did not like mamaliga. I don't many people liked it.
I ordered delivery they are take long time your people are slow

Some meals feed the body. Others remind you why we gather at the table in the first place.

As a business owner and consultant, timing and presentation matter deeply to me - especially when I‚Äôm sharing lunch with a client. The food must arrive on time, warm, and worthy of the moment. That‚Äôs why discovering Restaurant Moldova and meeting its wonderful owner, Radu, felt like finding a rare kind of partner in professionalism and passion.

Yesterday was the second time I trusted them to cater a client lunch - and for the second time, my client stopped mid-bite and said, ‚ÄúThis is the best food I‚Äôve ever tasted.‚Äù

That‚Äôs not luck. That‚Äôs craftsmanship. That‚Äôs heart.

So I write this not as a routine review, but as a note of gratitude - for the care you put into every dish, for the pride that shows in every delivery, and for the reminder that excellence still exists, quietly, beautifully, in places like yours.

Thank you, Radu, for what you‚Äôve built.
And thank you, Restaurant Moldova, for turning every meal into a story worth retelling.

Not completely order
Check utensils
Check the onions (I have not inside)
Bad:(

The food is okay. Not bad at all!
A lot of people really like this place and actually catering is amazing! My friends did it once.
Maybe I was trying wrong items, I might try something else next time.
In over all experience, it is exactly how you would feel in Moldova üá≤üá© so basically the did everything right.

This is one of my favorite restaurants! The food is always super tasty, and the way they serve it looks beautiful. It‚Äôs very cozy inside ‚Äî feels like a little museum, with all kinds of souvenirs hanging on the walls. The staff is always friendly and nice. I always go there with love, I just really enjoy this place. And the location is very convenient. Totally recommend!

This place feels like a secret waiting to be discovered. The menu offerings are incredibly good. You leave without that "overcharged" feeling. Every staff member performed outstandingly also. Every time I eat here, I leave satisfied.

Mincarea foarte bunƒÉ, zeama ca acasƒÉ.

Best food and service.
Professional and reliable service.

Amazing,food and service!Will come again!

The food was absolutely delicious! Everything was fresh amd so full of flavor! And the dessert was unbelievable. The server was so attentive, friendly and helpful. The reason I gave it 4 stars is that the bread they gave was cold, seemed like it was straight from the fridge, and they had no butter.

üá¨üáß MOLDOVA RESTAURANT ‚Äì HEARTFELT REVIEW

‚ú® Huge thanks to Moldova Restaurant for an unforgettable evening at our Mary Kay Company  end-of-year celebration!

üçΩÔ∏è The food was absolutely amazing!
Traditional Moldovan dishes like
ü•£ mamaliga with brynza,
ü•ü placinte,
üçÉ sarmale,
ü•ó and homemade appetizers ‚Äî
everything was made with love and full of authentic flavor. It truly felt like a warm hug from home.

üåü The service was outstanding!
We were served by a young lady and two gentlemen ‚Äî all of them were incredibly polite, attentive, friendly, and highly professional. Everything ran smoothly and with genuine care.

üíê We were truly delighted!
From the atmosphere and the service to the food ‚Äî everything was exceptional. This is a place we‚Äôll definitely return to again and again.

Thank you for the warmth, hospitality, and a deliciously memorable evening! ‚ù§Ô∏è

going to this restaurant for  years- never had any issues. amazing atmosphere, good food, the staff is treating you like a family.
Highly, Highly recommending. thank you
Perfect place for any occasion! Delicious cuisine and amazing staff! Thank for your job, guys! You are the best!
Great value and tastes great!

Beautiful, very tasty! Every time we try something new... Many thanks for the excellent staff service, as well as a separate Thanks to the Owner and Chef!!! ‚úåüòéüíôüíôüíôüíõüíõüíõüíñüíñüíñ
Un million de mese liber dar dacƒÉ e»ôti singur nu au miese...Asa un local Moldovenesc √Ænt√¢lnesc Moldovenii....
First time having Moldovan food and I‚Äôm in love! Great service and great food! The lunch specials are such a bargain!

Absolutely love the place! Very cozy home feel like ambiance. Delicious food and great service while reasonable prices. It's also BYOB. Karaoke on Fridays and live music and dancing on Saturdays. I am a return customer and highly recommend this place for either casual meal or a celebration üéâ
Service bad
Great atmosphere, good service.
Definitely recommend going during lunch special hours during the weekdays to save money from 11AM to 4PM. The mamaliga with sausage is a favorite!
Great restaurant, amazing food and the servers are polite and really paid attention to our table
Horrible ordered to go food all orders was messed up üòï‚Ä¶
Bad service
It was a great time and the kitchen is gorgeous.!
Food is horrible and service is not so good
Great service, best mititei and papanasi in NY!
Great hospitality, amazing food
That is an awesome place not just for Moldovan/Romanian/Ukrainian/Russian food but service and atmosfere as well. Highly recommended, and we'll be back!
One of the best places in Brooklyn to eat great food and service
Food is very tasty and authentic. Friendly and fast service.
The worst experience in very long time, food disgusting, I had stomach problems after I ate there, service so-so. Never will go back.
Fiod is fresh but super bland. Good for.a funeral not a party. It's cute looking like a village inside but also old and dingy.
Nice place. Family atmosphere
Great, lively restaurant with great food. The only complaint is that they forgot my plate and fork once.
Delicious food, very authentic, friendly and fast service, cozy atmosphere, feels like dinner at home with family.

Amazing experience with Moldova. I took Piciorute de Mail in SOS de Ciuperci, was amazing. Soups was great, desert was pancakes with cherry - you must try it. Atmosphere is cozy and relaxing. Very convincing location on Coney Island Ave. Nice decoration. Highly recommended place for breakfast, dinner and lunch. With family, friends or just romantic dinner.

We loved it here. The food was delicious. Authentic Moldovan cuisine. We couldn‚Äôt decide on what to order as everything was tempting so we ended by ordering a little of everything üòÖ
The service was excellent,everyone's so nice and friendly.
Definitely gonna come back. 100 % recommend it if you are looking for delicious dishes but still reasonable prices.
We had to order to go some more dishes‚Ä¶ and attaching some of the main entrees we enjoyed

We were there first time celebrating 1 year birthday party.  Great food, great service,  amazing atmosphere with a live music.  They also allowed us to bring our own decorations for photo shoot. We loved everything! Definitely be back and recommend everyone! Pricing is great too !!! And you can bring your own booze üòâ

If you‚Äôre looking for an authentic taste of Eastern Europe in NYC, Moldova Restaurant is a hidden gem that shouldn‚Äôt be missed! The cozy atmosphere and warm, welcoming staff make you feel right at home. The food is absolutely incredible - from the savory mamaliga to the delicious sarmale, each dish is bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. The portions are generous and the prices are very reasonable for the quality and authenticity you get. Whether you‚Äôre familiar with Moldovan cuisine or trying it for the first, Moldova Restaurant will leave you craving more. Highly recommend for anyone seeking a unique dining experience in the city!

We have great evening at Moldova at Christmas party for Mary Kay. So delicious kitchen, professional staff, nice atmosphere. Everything you need for your unforgettable party is here.
Thanks a lot, Moldova üòç
Alex & Alena from @lasershowusa

I found in the heart of Brooklyn a special place for my heart! Moldavian  restaurant with traditional food like from my childhood! Delicious  dishes exactly with the taste of  my beloved Bassarabia! A warm and welcoming atmosphere, especially warm service! I highly recommend this special place! Restaurant Moldova is in the top of my family's favorites! I gratefully recommend this place!!

My first time trying Moldovan food so I had to try the house specialty mamaliga which is also Moldova's National dish.  It reminded me of corn tamales from Mexican food.  Overall everything was tasty and hearty.

The lunch special has very generous portions - it came with three mamaligas, meat cubes, feta cheese salad and a compote drink.  What a great deal!

Very elegant restaurant; intriguing menu, great culinary execution.  Exotic in the sense that few New Yorkers  would probably be able to point to Moldova on a map.  It would be a good "date place" were it not for the fact that the restaurant has been criminally empty the three times I've been there.  On one hand, it's in a bad location -- there's not much foot traffic here, but on the other hand, there's quite a few similar (elegant; somewhat exotic, great food) places nearby... maybe that's problem.  I hope not, because I'd like to see this place thrive.

Loved the waitress.  The owner was super friendly (although I could do without the "Democrats suck" verbiage).  There's really nothing not to love about this restaurant.

Coltunasi FƒÉt-Frumos: B+
Coltunasi are dumplings; Moldovan pierogi.  FƒÉt-Frumos is a knight-hero in Romanian folklore; something like a Romanian Prince Charming (Romania is next door to Moldova).  The dumplings come in an earthen ceramic pot with sour cream on the side.  Somewhat bland; I would've liked the meat filling to stand out more, and I'm not sure being lumped in a bowl is the best presentation for the dish, but who doesn't love dumplings of any sort?

Costita: A-
A nicely grilled pork chop.  Excellent flavorings, and obviously grilled.  My kids absolutely loved it.  The only small criticism is that it was slightly overdone in places.  A more juicy, more fatty cut of meat would've been better.  Even so, this is a solid offering.

Pirjoale ca la Tiraspol: A+
My favorite dish here.  I'm not a fan of chicken breast; it's usually far too dry for me, and further more, I'm not a huge fan of gerkin pickles.  However, this was heavenly.  Superb.  The meat was juicy and soft.  The stuffed cheese / pickle was just ... phenomenal.  For me, this is the best dish on the menu.

Skirt Steak Salad: A
Heavenly salad.  The steak itself was clearly an A+: grilled and tasty (it was either skirt or hangar steak, both of which are very tasty cuts).  The salad was terrific.

Sarmale ca la Mama: A
Essentially "finger sized" stuffed cabbage.  Or maybe they can be described as dumplings with cabbage instead of dough.  In a word, scrumptious.  The cabbage and meat were soft enough to be cuttable with just a fork.  Juicy, tender, nicely seasoned.  Definitely an "A" dish.

Jumari (fried pork belly): C-
Tasteless with bad texture.  I've never had flavorless pork belly... it's basically bacon meat, right?  How in the WORLD can it be flavorless?  But moreover, it's obviously fried but dry and rubbery which tells me that it was fried previously but warmed (over warmed) in a microwave oven.  I found it to be inedible.   When we got back from the restaurant I literally threw this away.  I'm even wondering if it were pork belly to begin with.

Ursuleti:
Ordered by our group but I didn't eat it.  I'll have to try it next time.

That's a really good place, not noisey, prices are really affordable and the food is so delicious, we all loved it. It's clean and service is good. Interesting interior decor, done in traditional Moldavian style. Place is clean. They have a kinda separated room for a bigger event if you need to. All the time we go there - parking is not a problem.
On site they have a photographer who takes pictures and give them to you for free, but only the small once, if you need normal size pics it's a $20 but the frame is a solid, beautiful one, not like paper once you get all other places.
What I would suggest them is to have a menus with the food pictures, it would be easier for people to understand what it is, especially for those who is not familiar with Moldavian food.

Comfortable dining experience at a traditional Moldovan restaurant, great experience and even better food! Would highly suggest the fasoli»õƒÉ and the Mititei, serving sizes are generous and for a drink definitely get the compot (assorted fruit punch). Delicious crepes with sour cherries and sour cream had a beautiful, unique design and a memorable taste.

Update: Let's talk about dessert! Baba neagra is my newly found favorite, the moistness has the perfect balance. Though I have to admit it was difficult to sit down and not dance with my childhood's lively music in the background.

We loved the food, finally some tasty Moldavian taste in Brooklyn. The place is very clean with nice venue. The only thing is I believe they need to work on training the serving stuffs better and improve their customer service. But the food is top

How good that we found this wonderful restaurant "Moldova" on the day of our anniversary! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Great interior, nice prices, friendly staff, delicious.
Thank you for the delicious food and wine.
They also have a banquet hall.
I recommend the restaurant "Moldova"!!!

Delicious food and excellent service. I went with my Moldovan friend to this place, and he said it felt just like home. I‚Äôve never eaten Moldovan food before and I must say that everyone should try it at least once in their lives. My‚Ä¶

Must try place. Everything we ordered was very tasty. This was my first time trying moldovian cuisine and we received a lot of recommendations on what to choose. Everything was right on point. Staff was very friendly, and attentive.

Being back after a long time, it was great to enjoy the best pies in NYC! Truly delicious and Authentic Moldavian food, exactly as my mom used to make. The atmosphere was great and the service was excellent, we love Dina‚ù§Ô∏è

From start to finish, everything was simply exceptional. The flavors were rich, the dishes perfectly prepared, and each bite left us wanting more. The attention to detail in every meal made it clear that quality and freshness are top priorities. Whether it was the appetizers, mains, or desserts, every course was a delightful experience. Truly a place where every dish is as delicious as it is satisfying!
Thank you !!! I will always come back to here to feel at home!! ü•Çü•Çüëåüëå

This is a such special restaurant, always delicious, warm and inviting. My favorite dishes are always prepared with the same care and flavor as my Mom cooked for me back in my childhood. Great service from Dana and Radu. The house-made wine out of Moldova grapes made our dinner so fine, and the compliment grape-moonshine shot made our visit unforgettable. Great spot to eat healthy and consistent when you‚Äôre in Brooklyn. Surprisingly affordable priced, full diner for two people with 3 courses and amazing wine for only 100$, that‚Äôs truly a gem. I always can‚Äôt wait to go back, this is definitely my favorite restaurant and it always have been! Getting out from Westchester and travelling  all the way to Brooklyn - joy totally worth the sacrifice.
I'm from Moldova and I can tell you they have people from aldova cooking the food so it's very authentic inside and makes me feel like I'm back home thank you so much I'm the big coometro in town

I liked everything in this restaurant - food, drinks, music, interior, staff, just wonderful atmosphere.  It is a great place to spend an amazing time  with your family or friends ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

I strongly advise you to visit this wonderful restaurant.
Fresh light salad, wonderful cheese, magical meat - I'm just amazed how delicious everything is.
There is a delivery too.
Many thanks to the chef for my delicious lunch.

This is my favorite restaurant and it is very cozy and very homely and the food is very tasty. I enjoy the home atmosphere! I feel like I am at home in Moldova!!! The food is very tasty and everything is served beautifully! I enjoy the atmosphere! The girls are very nice and the service is great! Everything is served to us so beautifully! I have never seen such girls Dinochka ,  Gala and Kristina!!!!üíì‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüòäü•∞ü•™ü§©üëçüíúü§ç

Old World bargain. Delicious interpretation of Romanian classics like mamaligga plus cheese and cornmeal combos, pastries, salads and meats. Filling and hearty, take lots of friends, bring home lots of leftovers.

This was an unexpected pleasure!  I was looking for a highly rated restaurant in the neighborhood of Moldova and saw a high average rating and realized I not only never ate Moldovian food, but I didn't even know where Moldova was located.‚Ä¶

Went here because when else in my life can I get Moldovan food outside Chi»ôinƒÉu? It surely delivered! The ambience was extremely homey and the food was flavorful and thoughtfully prepared. We will be coming back soon!

Kuddos Moldova Restaurant! We were there for a little corporate Winter Party and the food was delicious! The lamb chop, the salmon ,the grilled veggies were to die for. Traditional Moldovan Pies were very good too. Tuna tartare was better than Michelin star restaurant and we appreciated having the TV with sound system for our use and entertainment. Speak with Radu or Anastasia, they will definitely bring your visions to life! Cristina the waitress was very kind too. So pleasant to have her. Big thank you!
Amazing Authentic Moldovan cuisine, very cozy and well decorated, very friendly staff, will definitely return. The rabbit was particularly delicious and the "Napoleon" cake.

This restaurant is one of my top favorite places in NYC. Such amazing homemade food, always fresh and delicious. For our party that we had recently they made everything possible to accommodate our special requests. It's always nice to be here and enjoy the atmosphere and food.
